meta.title: Licensing (Retail Sales) Act 1988
meta.preamble: An Act to amend the definition of "sale by retail" in section 201 of the Licensing Act 1964; and for connected purposes.
meta.words_of_enactment: Be it enacted by the Queen's most Excellent Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the authority of the same, as follows

br.font: Amendment of definition of "sale by retail" in Licensing Act 1964.
Repeal of section 181 of Licensing Act 1964.

td.br: 2. In consequence of section 1 of this Act, section 181 of the Licensing Act 1964 (which enables a wholesaler to sell by retail without a justices' licence in certain circumstances) is hereby repealed.

4.— (1) This Act may be cited as the Licensing (Retail Sales) Act 1988. (2) This Act shall come into force on such day as the Secretary of State may appoint by order made by statutory instrument. (3) This Act does not extend to Scotland or Northern Ireland.
